name: Caesars Atlantic City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We opted for the lowest priced room and that was a big mistake. We were in the older section (Temple North) of the hotel (someone said it was originally a Howard Johnsons hotel). Our first room was spacious but had no window; I felt like I was put in a back room. We requested another room and they kindly assigned another room on the same floor. It had a window but the view was of a rooftop with HVAC units and the side of another building. The room was a decent size but had a very small bathroom. Next time, I'll pay the higher rate or stay elsewhere. Aside from the room, they have great restaurants and casinos. However, when will Atlantic City go to total nonsmoking in the casinos? The odor was everywhere, even in non smoking sections.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: I used to stay at the Tropicana while in AC but after a bad experience with the management there, I have been trying a few other places on the strip. Caesars is good and bad ... it could be great but the customer service will not make it any better than average.
reviews.title: Nickle and dime fees/no special attention

reviews.text: The first thing I noticed about Caesar's is that they claim on their website to charge 'no resort fee' like a lot of the other casino hotels do on the strip. Okay, so the room prices are a little more than the other casinos ... but you save $5 right? WRONG. There is a $5 'room booking fee' added. Nobody could explain what this was to me except for the fact that it is a non-removable charge. The fact that I booked through the website that claimed they did not charge a $5 resort fee was pretty funny, considering anyone who books a room at Caesar's will pay this $5 room booking fee. Unless you are a diamond member of the casino rewards program, you will pay what anyone else would for parking in the garage, $5 for your stay.
reviews.title: Black Friday 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out of all the casinos in Atlantic City I will say that the decor inside Caesar's is my favorite. However, while I was there I noticed that all the fountains were turned off for cleaning on the first day I was there making it somewhat less spectacular. Also, I noticed that the buffet closed at 8 p.m. or some ridiculous early time. The restaurant, Mia was also closed on certain days. I know the casinos are trying to save some money because people are gambling less, but come on.
reviews.title: Very nice accommodations on the Boardwalk

reviews.text: My room request was for a premium king, which was 3 steps above an average room. Aside from a suite, it was the most expensive room level. (the level below that is almost always sold out) When I got there, they claimed they did not get my request for a king ... all they had was two double beds in that class of room. What could I do but take it? They didnt offer me any consoltation and bearly an apology. I also wanted an ocean view room ... they gave me one on the side of the building with a slight view of the ocean and more of a view of the heating and ac units on the building next door.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.
Fail Caesar
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to do a roadtrip with the kids while visiting relatives in Philadelphia, so went to Caesar's Atlantic City after Christmas. I visit AC frequently, but this was our kids' first time. ( two daughters ages 9 & 7) Obviously, this was not a beach trip since it is December, but our expectations were to have a nice time shopping and eating and strolling ( weather permitting ) around the boardwalk and hotel. I am a Total Rewards member, but planned to gamble just a few hours in the morning of departure. I made the reservation at Caesar's because of its proximity to the shopping and ocean front views. I thought the $209 rate was a bit steep for essentially an offseason double room, but could not determine from the website if suites were available, which is our preference when traveling with the children. We arrived around 2pm and waited nearly 40 minutes to check in despite there being about a dozen people in line ahead of us. There were four clerks for the diamond club check in and two for regular guests. Of those two clerks, they would intermittently disappear or stop checking in guests to talk amongst themselves. There was no sense of urgency or welcome to the process. When we checked in, we asked about suites availability to give our children their own space but were told nothing was available. The clerk explained that the website does not show the suites unless they are available. While we signed in, we overheard the people checking in next to us being upgraded a room upon request. Our room was in the Centurion tower and we had a cityscape view. It was a nice size, clean and comfortable, but located in some corner lock-out area behind a heavy hall door that led to the room door. It happened to be raining throughout the day and evening, so we did not go outside of the casino/hotel the first day and night. The hotel does not have a game room and the pool was not open, so two strikes against the kids having fun outside of watching movies and playing games in the room. We had lunch in one of the restaurants in the Pier area ( Continental) and dinner at the Morton's steakhouse. Morton's does not have a kids menu, but you can order off the bar menu for them to keep the overall meal cost reasonable. We learned the next morning that the breakfast buffet is not open during the week, so that dinged our breakfast plans. We departed late morning the next day and while we have no complaints about the actual room, I don't think I would return to Caesar's with OR without the wife and kids. The confluence of odd little missteps ( no shower caps, room service order without enough utensils, odd staff interactions ) suggests that not only is there a lack of business savvy to offer family friendly amenities during a holiday week, but an indifference to the kind of experiences they would want their guests to have away from the tables and slots.

reviews.title: You can find better places to stay
reviews.text: We booked thru expedia so maybe we got the cheap room. Our room overlooked the hotel lobby, we were only there for 1 night so we didn't make a big deal about it. That was our first mistake!! At 2:30am the music from the lobby was so loud that it made it impossible to sleep. We called the front desk and didn't get any help, so we called security. Security came to our room and couldn't believe how loud the music was that was being piped in the lobby. My husband had to then go to the front desk and ask for a new room. The person who was working at the front desk said that the hotel was booked and that there were no more rooms available.

reviews.title: Comfort with a view!
reviews.text: Finally after my husband insisted that he better find us another room at a differrent hotel a room miraculously became available. So there we are on our 1 night getaway changing rooms at 3:00 in the morning!

reviews.title: Disappointing in so many ways.
reviews.text: The next morning we went down to ask for a refund for our wonderful night and the person at the front desk told us that since we booked thru Expedia that we would have to take it up with them. Again making their problem our problem. We asked to speak to the hotel manager and he said that he would take care of our refund and that we should see a credit within a week.

reviews.title: Good room but not great
reviews.text: Don't stay in room 512!!!!!! Unless you only plan on using the room to shower!!

reviews.title: Great View
reviews.text: I know I can never tire of the view of our beautiful Atlantic Ocean and our view from the 43rd floor of Caesars this past week is no exception. Check in was fairly effortless and our request for an ocean view was handled nicely. I will admit that the furnishings are beginning to look a little worn and the "amenities" in the bathroom did not seem as plentiful as previous stays. The addition of the open air "cafe" in the lobby is nice but some seating would be helpful.

reviews.title: Excellent stay!
reviews.text: We stayed in a Premium room in Centurion Tower. The best feature is a TV right in the batroom mirror. You can watch it even during taking shower! Otherwise, bathroom is very big and very clean. Room itself is pretty spacious with very cosy beds.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel Lousy Front Desk
reviews.text: Overall, location of the casino is unbeatable, right in the midst of everything including very nice mall with lots of dining choices. Continental is our favorite.

reviews.title: AC Getaway
reviews.text: Will definitely return.

reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!!
reviews.text: Caesar's is a very nice property that needs to spend some money on customer service training. We had issues when we tried to check in and waited for almost thirty minutes, without any apology.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got upgraded to the Centurion Tower after we asked to be moved from the handicap accessible room they had put us in. Spacious room, large bathroom and shower. We were near the elevator, which I usually don't like due to noise concerns, but we never heard any hallway noise all night. Amazing view from the room too. The TV inside the bathroom mirror was cool.
reviews.title: Centurion Tower Room

reviews.text: stayed here on ce or twice. very nice roooms and the hotel is always looking good. employees are very helpful with what ever you need. actually the first hotel i ever stayed in AC.
reviews.title: very nice property....the whole hotel is nice

reviews.text: The old towers are a bit dated and the furnishings could use renovation. But the new tower is absolutely gorgeous. Don't really get the utility of a behind-the-bathroom-mirror TV but its cool anyway!
reviews.title: Great hotel, if you stay in the new tower

reviews.text: One of the best 4 night stays in Atlantic in the past 5 years. this hotel is by far the best one i have stayed in here. I had a corner room in the Cneturion Tower and the View was unbelievable. Just 180 degrees of Atlantic Ocean!!!
reviews.title: Edge of Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants are excellent (all of them) and the Bakery is out of this world.
reviews.title: GET there early or you don't get the ROOM you booked?

aka: Caesars Atlantic City Hotel Atlantic City
